intro: Sopubia scabra, commonly known as the rough sopubia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sopubia scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
